name: My Home and Native Land Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: What Canadian city calls itself the "Honeymoon Capital" of the world?
questions.explanation:
Niagara Falls & Niagara.

	Niagara Falls is popular for its many hotels, restaurants, and various funhouses and tourist attractions.

questions.text: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation:
Ottawa.

	Toronto, Charlottetown, and Halifax are the capitals of  Ontario, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia respectively. Kingston, Ontario was originally the capital of Canada.

questions.text: Which of these cities is NOT in Ontario?
Which of these singers does not hail from Canada?
questions.explanation:
Kelly Clarkson.

	Avril Lavigne and Shania Twain are both from Ontario, and Celine Dion is from Quebec. Kelly Clarkson was the first "American Idol."

questions.text: What is the national animal of Canada?
questions.explanation:
Beaver.

	Many people think that the loon, pictured on a Canadian dollar coin, is the national animal, but it is the beaver.

questions.text: What is the capital of Nunavut?
questions.explanation:
Iqaluit.

	Saskatoon, Brandon and Hamilton are in Saskatchewan, Manitoba and Ontario respectively.

questions.text: In Canada, production of one-cent-pieces ceased in the 20th century.
questions.explanation:
False.

	One-cent-pieces are no longer produced in Canada, but their production didn't cease until 2012.

questions.text: In Canada, there are ten provinces and two territories.
questions.explanation:
False.

	There are ten provinces and three territories.

True.

	The national languages of Canada are English and French.

questions.text: What is the title of Canada's national anthem?
questions.explanation:
O Canada.

	"God Save the Queen" was the national anthem of Canada until 1980, when "O Canada" became the official national anthem.
